ground_truth: The HUM OF THE RING seems to grow louder in Frodo's ears as Gimli suddenly stands, excited, and rushes forward, swinging his axe down on the ring. The axe shatters with a deafening crack, and Gimli falls backward, staring in disbelief at the ring, unharmed. Frodo winces as an angry image of the fiery eye hits him, making him slump in his chair, clutching his forehead, while Gandalf looks at him with concern. Stunned silence follows, and the council sits with downcast eyes, as if a great dread has descended on them. Boromir addresses the council in a quiet voice, and Gimli leaps to his feet. Frodo, motionless, experiences angry faces, shaking fists, accusatory fingers, and his eyes move across to the ring, as the hum grows louder in his head. The screen fills with an image of the Ring, streams of blood flowing across its surface, and flames flicker within the Gold Band. Frodo, breathing rapidly and caught in the grip of his hideous vision, with a huge effort or will, tears his gaze upon the ring and suddenly stands, speaking in a strong, clear voice. A sudden silence occurs as Frodo looks around at the astounded faces. Boromir looks at everyone, then walks towards Frodo, and looks towards Elrond and Gandalf. Frodo stares in wonder as the Greatest Fighters in all Middle-earth stand at his side. Merry and Pippin jump up from behind another bush as an old sword slides out of a shabby leather scabbard, its polished, well-tended blade glittering cold and bright. Bilbo offers Sting to Frodo and unwraps a small shirt of close woven mail. Frodo peels off his shirt, revealing The Ring on the chain around his neck when suddenly a shadow passes across Bilbo, and for a split second, he becomes a wrinkled creature with a hungry face and bony, groping hands. Frodo pulls away, shocked, and the shadow passes. Bilbo slumps into a chair, his head in his hands, faltering, his eyes filling with tears as he sobs, and Frodo moves to comfort him. The Fellowship climbs the long steep path out of the cloven vale of Rivendell, and they trek through a land of deep valleys and turbulent waters, with the Misty Mountains rising sharply to their left. Sam is at the campfire as Gimli manages to corner Gandalf. Boromir thrusts, catching Pippin on the hand, who then throws down his sword, kicks, and lunges at Boromir, tackling him to the ground, followed by much laughter. Legolas' eyes are fixed on a distant dark patch that darts about the sky like flying smoke in the wind, while Gandalf looks at Aragorn and turns to the others, gesturing towards a high mountain pass. The Fellowship clamber through rock and snow as Frodo slips on some shale and the Ring falls on the ground. The ring gleams in the snow as Boromir's hand picks it up by the chain, and he stands with the ring dangling before his eyes.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description:
Certainly! Here's the text transformed with synonyms:

The BUZZ OF THE LOOP seems to grow louder in Frodo's ears as Gimli suddenly stands, enthused, and dashes forward, swinging his hatchet down on the loop. The hatchet shatters with a thunderous crack, and Gimli tumbles backward, gazing in disbelief at the loop, unscathed. Frodo winces as an irate image of the fiery eye assails him, causing him to slump in his chair, clutching his forehead, while Gandalf regards him with concern. Stunned silence follows, and the council sits with downcast eyes, as if a great terror has descended on them. Boromir addresses the council in a quiet voice, and Gimli springs to his feet. Frodo, motionless, experiences furious faces, shaking fists, accusatory fingers, and his eyes move across to the loop, as the buzz grows louder in his head. The screen fills with an image of the Loop, streams of blood coursing across its surface, and flames flicker within the Gold Circlet. Frodo, breathing rapidly and captured in the grasp of his grotesque vision, with a huge effort or will, tears his gaze upon the loop and suddenly stands, speaking in a strong, clear voice. A sudden silence occurs as Frodo looks around at the astounded faces. Boromir looks at everyone, then strides towards Frodo, and looks towards Elrond and Gandalf. Frodo stares in awe as the Supreme Warriors in all Middle-earth stand at his side. Merry and Pippin leap up from behind another shrub as an old sword slides out of a shabby leather scabbard, its polished, well-tended blade gleaming cold and bright. Bilbo offers Sting to Frodo and unwraps a small shirt of close woven mail. Frodo peels off his shirt, revealing The Loop on the chain around his neck when suddenly a shadow passes across Bilbo, and for a split moment, he becomes a wrinkled creature with a hungry face and bony, groping hands. Frodo pulls away, shocked, and the shadow passes. Bilbo slumps into a chair, his head in his hands, faltering, his eyes filling with tears as he sobs, and Frodo moves to comfort him. The Fellowship scales the long steep path out of the cloven vale of Rivendell, and they trek through a land of deep valleys and turbulent waters, with the Misty Mountains ascending sharply to their left. Sam is at the campfire as Gimli manages to corner Gandalf. Boromir thrusts, catching Pippin on the hand, who then throws down his sword, kicks, and lunges at Boromir, tackling him to the ground, followed by much laughter. Legolas' eyes are fixed on a distant dark patch that darts about the sky like flying smoke in the wind, while Gandalf looks at Aragorn and turns to the others, gesturing towards a high mountain pass. The Fellowship clamber through rock and snow as Frodo slips on some shale and the Loop falls on the ground. The loop glints in the snow as Boromir's hand picks it up by the chain, and he stands with the loop dangling before his eyes.

With a deafening crack, the axe is shattered, and Gimli is made to fall backward, staring in disbelief at the ring, unharmed. Frodo is caused to wince as an angry image of the fiery eye hits him, making him slump in his chair, while his forehead is clutched by him, and Gandalf looks at him with concern. Stunned silence follows, and the council is sat with downcast eyes, as if a great dread had descended on them. The council is addressed by Boromir in a quiet voice, and Gimli is leapt to his feet by him. Frodo, motionless, is made to experience angry faces, shaking fists, accusatory fingers, and his eyes are moved by him across to the ring, as the hum is grown louder in his head. The screen is filled with an image of the Ring, streams of blood are flowed across its surface, and flames flicker within the Gold Band. Frodo, breathing rapidly and caught in the grip of his hideous vision, tears his gaze from the ring with a huge effort of will and suddenly stands, speaking in a strong, clear voice. A sudden silence is occurred as Frodo looks around at the astounded faces. Everyone is looked at by Boromir, who then walks towards Frodo, and Elrond and Gandalf are looked towards by him. Frodo stares in wonder as the Greatest Fighters in all Middle-earth are stood at his side. Merry and Pippin are jumped up from behind another bush by them as an old sword is slid out of a shabby leather scabbard, its polished, well-tended blade glittering cold and bright. Frodo peels off his shirt, revealing The Ring on the chain around his neck when suddenly a shadow is passed across Bilbo, and for a split second, he is made to become a wrinkled creature with a hungry face and bony, groping hands. Frodo is pulled away, shocked, and the shadow is passed. Bilbo slumps into a chair, his head in his hands, faltering, his eyes are filled with tears as he sobs, and Frodo moves to comfort him. The long steep path out of the cloven vale of Rivendell is climbed by The Fellowship, and a land of deep valleys and turbulent waters is trekked through by them, with the Misty Mountains rising sharply to their left. A distant dark patch is fixed upon by Legolas' eyes that darts about the sky like flying smoke in the wind, while Aragorn is looked at by Gandalf and he turns to the others, gesturing towards a high mountain pass. Rock and snow are clambered through by The Fellowship as Frodo is made to slip on some shale and the Ring is caused to fall on the ground. In the snow, Boromir's hand picks up the ring by the chain, and he stands with the ring dangling before his eyes.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The HUM OF THE RING grows louder in Frodo's ears as Gimli eagerly stands and swings his axe at the ring. The axe shatters loudly, and Gimli falls back, shocked that the ring remains unharmed. Frodo winces as a fiery eye image hits him, making him slump and clutch his forehead, while Gandalf watches with concern. A stunned silence ensues, and the council sits with downcast eyes, feeling a heavy dread. Boromir quietly addresses the council; Gimli jumps up, and Frodo experiences angry faces and shaking fists, his gaze fixed on the ring. The screen fills with the ring, streams of blood, and flickering flames. Frodo, breathing quickly and caught in a horrifying vision, with effort, tears his gaze from the ring and speaks clearly. Silence falls as Frodo looks around at amazed faces. Boromir approaches Frodo, glancing at Elrond and Gandalf. Frodo marvels as Middle-earth's greatest fighters stand beside him. Merry and Pippin jump up as an old sword slides from a shabby scabbard, its polished blade bright. Bilbo offers Sting and unwraps a small mail shirt. Frodo removes his shirt, revealing the ring on a chain when suddenly a shadow crosses Bilbo, turning him into a wrinkled creature with a hungry face briefly. Shocked, Frodo pulls away, and the shadow passes. Bilbo slumps into a chair, tears in his eyes, as Frodo comforts him. The Fellowship climbs the steep path out of Rivendell, trekking through valleys and waters, with the Misty Mountains towering to their left. Sam tends the campfire as Gimli corners Gandalf. Boromir accidentally hits Pippin's hand, causing him to throw down his sword and tackle Boromir, leading to laughter. Legolas focuses on a distant dark patch darting like smoke, while Gandalf gestures to a high mountain pass. The Fellowship climbs through rock and snow; Frodo slips, and the ring falls into the snow. Boromir picks it up by the chain, the ring gleaming in the snow, and stands with it dangling before his eyes.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The HUM OF THE RING grows in Frodo's ears as Gimli excitedly stands and swings his axe at the ring, which remains unscathed while his axe shatters. Frodo winces at the fiery eye's image, slumping and clutching his forehead as Gandalf watches. Silence follows, and the council is somber. Boromir quietly speaks to the council, and Gimli stands. Frodo sees angry faces, and his eyes move to the ring as its hum intensifies. The screen shows the Ring with blood and flickering flames. Frodo suddenly stands, speaking clearly. Silence follows as the Greatest Fighters stand beside him. Merry and Pippin leap up, and Bilbo offers Frodo Sting and a mail shirt. Frodo removes his shirt, revealing The Ring. A shadow passes over Bilbo, turning him into a creature briefly; Frodo pulls away, shocked, as Bilbo sobs and Frodo comforts him. The Fellowship climbs out of Rivendell through valleys and Misty Mountains. Sam is at the campfire as Gimli talks to Gandalf. Boromir and Pippin playfully fight, ending in laughter. Legolas watches a dark patch in the sky while Gandalf gestures to a mountain pass. The Fellowship climbs through rock and snow. Frodo slips, dropping the Ring, which Boromir picks up, holding it before his eyes.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The low, persistent HUM OF THE RING seems to grow increasingly louder and more intense in Frodo's ears as Gimli, suddenly overtaken by excitement and determination, stands abruptly. He rushes forward with purpose, swinging his axe down forcefully onto the ring. With a deafening, resounding crack, the axe shatters into pieces, and Gimli is thrown backward, landing with a thud, staring in disbelief and awe at the ring, which remains completely unharmed. Frodo winces sharply as an angry, vivid image of the fiery eye flashes in his mind, causing him to slump wearily in his chair, clutching his forehead in distress, while Gandalf glances at him with deepening concern. A stunned silence envelops the room, with the council seated and their eyes cast downwards, as if an overwhelming sense of dread has descended upon them all. In a quiet, measured voice, Boromir addresses the council, and in response, Gimli leaps energetically to his feet. Meanwhile, Frodo remains motionless, experiencing visions of angry faces, shaking fists, and pointed accusatory fingers. His eyes inadvertently drift across to the ring, as the hum inside his head intensifies even further. The screen is filled with an ominous image of the Ring, with streams of blood flowing eerily across its surface, and flickering flames igniting within the golden band. Frodo, breathing rapidly and trapped within the grips of this hideous vision, with an enormous effort of willpower, forcefully tears his gaze away from the ring and suddenly stands up, speaking in a voice that is strong and clear. A sudden, profound silence falls over the room as Frodo looks around at the astonished faces surrounding him. Boromir glances at everyone present, then walks over towards Frodo, casting a look in the direction of Elrond and Gandalf. Frodo gazes in wonder as the greatest fighters in all of Middle-earth stand resolutely at his side. Merry and Pippin jump up in excitement from behind another bush as an old sword is slowly drawn from a shabby leather scabbard, its polished, well-maintained blade glittering coldly and brightly. Bilbo offers the renowned sword Sting to Frodo and carefully unwraps a small shirt made of intricately close-woven mail. Frodo slowly peels off his shirt, revealing The Ring hanging on the chain around his neck when suddenly a shadow momentarily passes across Bilbo, transforming him for a split second into a wrinkled creature with a hungry face and bony, groping hands. Startled and shocked, Frodo pulls away, and the fleeting shadow passes. Bilbo slumps heavily into a chair, his head buried in his hands, faltering with his eyes filling with tears as he begins to sob, and Frodo moves to comfort him gently. The Fellowship embarks on their journey, climbing the long, steep path leading out of the cloven vale of Rivendell. They trek through a land characterized by deep valleys and turbulent waters, with the majestic Misty Mountains rising sharply to their left. Sam tends to the campfire as Gimli manages to corner Gandalf for a private conversation. Boromir thrusts playfully, catching Pippin on the hand, who then throws down his sword, kicks out in defiance, and lunges at Boromir, tackling him to the ground, resulting in a burst of laughter among them. Legolas' keen eyes are fixed intently on a distant dark patch that moves erratically across the sky, resembling flying smoke in the wind, while Gandalf exchanges a look with Aragorn and then turns to the others, gesturing towards a high mountain pass that looms ahead. The Fellowship clambers through rock and snow as Frodo slips precariously on some loose shale, causing the Ring to fall to the ground. The ring gleams with a chilling light in the snow as Boromir's hand reaches down to pick it up by the chain, and he stands there, gazing at the ring dangling before his eyes.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The constant, low, and persistent *HUM OF THE RING* seems to swell and grow increasingly louder, becoming more intense with each passing moment in Frodo's ears. The sound reverberates almost overwhelmingly as Gimli, who is suddenly overcome by a surge of excitement and burning determination, stands up abruptly and without hesitation. He hastily rushes forward with a determined purpose, swinging his hefty axe down with all his might directly onto the ring. With a deafening, resounding crack that echoes throughout the room, the axe shatters into countless pieces, and Gimli is thrown backward by the sheer force, landing with a heavy thud. He looks up, staring in sheer disbelief and awe at the unyielding ring, which remains completely unharmed and untouched. Frodo winces sharply as an angry, vivid image of the fiery eye invades his mind, causing him to slump wearily in his chair, clutching his forehead in visible distress and discomfort, while Gandalf glances at him with deepening concern etched onto his face. A stunned, profound silence wraps itself around the room, with the members of the council seated, their eyes cast downwards, as if an overwhelming sense of dread and foreboding has descended upon them all. In a quiet, measured voice that barely disturbs the silence, Boromir addresses the council, and in response, Gimli leaps energetically to his feet. Meanwhile, Frodo remains motionless, trapped in haunting visions of angry faces, shaking fists, and pointed accusatory fingers. His eyes inadvertently drift towards the ring, as the persistent hum inside his head intensifies to an almost unbearable level. The screen is filled with a foreboding, ominous image of the Ring, with streams of blood flowing eerily and mysteriously across its surface, while flickering flames ignite menacingly within the golden band. Frodo, breathing rapidly and feeling trapped within the grips of this hideous vision, summons an enormous effort of willpower, forcefully tearing his gaze away from the ring and suddenly standing up, speaking in a voice that is strong, clear, and unwavering. A sudden, profound silence falls over the room as Frodo looks around at the astonished faces surrounding him. Boromir glances at everyone present, then deliberately walks over towards Frodo, casting a meaningful look in the direction of Elrond and Gandalf. Frodo gazes in wonder and amazement as the greatest fighters in all of Middle-earth stand resolutely at his side. Merry and Pippin leap up in excitement from behind another bush as an old sword is slowly drawn from a shabby leather scabbard, its polished, well-maintained blade glittering coldly and brightly. Bilbo offers the renowned sword Sting to Frodo and carefully unwraps a small shirt made of intricately close-woven mail. Frodo slowly peels off his shirt, revealing The Ring hanging on the chain around his neck when suddenly a shadow momentarily passes across Bilbo, transforming him for a split second into a wrinkled creature with a hungry face and bony, grasping hands. Startled and shocked, Frodo instinctively pulls away, and the fleeting shadow mercifully passes. Bilbo slumps heavily into a chair, his head buried in his hands, faltering with his eyes filling with tears as he begins to sob uncontrollably, and Frodo moves to comfort him gently. The Fellowship embarks on their perilous journey, climbing the long, steep, and arduous path that leads out of the cloven vale of Rivendell. They trek through a land characterized by deep, shadowy valleys and turbulent, rushing waters, with the majestic Misty Mountains rising sharply and dramatically to their left. Sam diligently tends to the crackling campfire as Gimli manages to corner Gandalf for a private, whispered conversation. Boromir thrusts playfully, catching Pippin on the hand, who then throws down his sword in mock frustration, kicks out in defiance, and lunges at Boromir, tackling him to the ground, resulting in a burst of laughter and camaraderie among them. Legolas' keen, watchful eyes are fixed intently on a distant, dark patch that moves erratically across the sky, resembling flying smoke caught in the wind's capricious grasp, while Gandalf exchanges a knowing look with Aragorn and then turns to the others, gesturing towards a high mountain pass that looms ominously ahead. The Fellowship clambers through treacherous rock and snow as Frodo slips perilously on some loose shale, causing the Ring to fall to the ground. The ring gleams with a chilling, sinister light in the snow as Boromir's hand reaches down to pick it up by the chain, and he stands there, mesmerized and transfixed, gazing at the ring dangling provocatively before his eyes.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the constant hum of the Ring intensifies in Frodo's ears, Gimli abruptly springs up, brimming with excitement, and charges forward, his axe ready to strike as he brings it down forcefully onto the Ring. The moment the blade makes contact, a deafening crack resonates as the axe shatters into pieces, causing Gimli to tumble backward onto the ground. He lies there, his eyes wide with incredulity as he stares at the Ring, which remains completely unharmed by the blow. Meanwhile, Frodo winces in pain as a searing image of a fiery eye invades his mind, forcing him to slump back into his chair, his hands instinctively clutching his forehead in distress. Gandalf notices Frodo’s discomfort and studies him with deep concern etched across his face. The room is enveloped in a stunned silence, the council members sitting with their heads lowered, as if a heavy, inescapable dread has settled upon them. In this oppressive atmosphere, Boromir begins to speak in a hushed voice, addressing the council, prompting Gimli to leap to his feet in reaction. As Frodo remains motionless, trapped in the turmoil of his thoughts, he envisions angry faces, shaking fists, and accusatory fingers all directed at him, and his gaze drifts over to the Ring, the hum in his head swelling to an almost overwhelming intensity. Suddenly, the screen is filled with an image of the Ring, and Frodo sees streams of blood flowing across its surface, flames flickering ominously within the Gold Band. As his breathing becomes rapid in response to the horrifying vision gripping him, Frodo summons a tremendous amount of willpower to wrench his gaze away from the Ring. He then rises abruptly, speaking with an unexpected strength and clarity in his voice that brings an immediate halt to all conversation. A silence descends as he looks around, noting the astonished expressions on the faces surrounding him. Boromir surveys everyone in the room before making his way towards Frodo, casting a glance at Elrond and Gandalf as he does so. Frodo regards this development with wonder as the Greatest Fighters from all of Middle-earth stand resolute at his side. From behind another bush, Merry and Pippin jump up enthusiastically, and an old sword emerges from a worn leather scabbard, its blade, polished and meticulously cared for, glinting cold and bright in the light. Bilbo offers the sword, known as Sting, to Frodo, while also unwrapping a small shirt made of closely woven mail. As Frodo removes his shirt, the Ring comes into view, hanging on a chain around his neck, when suddenly a shadow passes over Bilbo, transforming him for a brief moment into a wrinkled creature with a ravenous expression, his hands bony and reaching. Startled, Frodo pulls away from Bilbo, and the eerie shadow quickly dissipates. Filled with remorse, Bilbo slumps into a chair, burying his head in his hands, his eyes brimming with tears as he begins to sob, prompting Frodo to move closer, offering comfort to his distraught uncle. The Fellowship then begins their ascent along the long, steep path leading out of the cloven vale of Rivendell, journeying through a land characterized by deep valleys and tumultuous waters, with the imposing Misty Mountains sharply rising to their left. In the midst of all this, Sam tends to the campfire while Gimli manages to corner Gandalf for a private discussion. At the same time, Boromir is engaged in a playful skirmish with Pippin, resulting in Pippin dropping his sword. Pippin then kicks and lunges at Boromir, tackling him to the ground, an act followed by hearty laughter among the group. Meanwhile, Legolas stands apart, his gaze fixed on a distant, dark patch that flits across the sky like smoke carried by the wind, prompting Gandalf to exchange a look with Aragorn before turning to the others and gesturing towards the challenge of a high mountain pass. The Fellowship then begins their treacherous climb, navigating through rock and snow, when Frodo suddenly loses his footing on some loose shale, causing the Ring to slip from his grasp and fall to the ground. There, the Ring gleams enticingly in the snow until Boromir's hand reaches down to pick it up by the chain, and he rises to his feet, the Ring dangling temptingly before his eyes.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The HUM OF THE RING intensifies for Frodo as Gimli, in a burst of excitement, attempts to destroy it with his axe, which shatters upon impact, leaving the ring untouched. Frodo, hit by the vision of a fiery eye, clutches his forehead and slumps in his seat, while Gandalf watches with concern. Silence envelops the council, weighed down by a sense of dread, as Boromir quietly addresses the group. Frodo, motionless amid growing chaos in his mind, fixates on the ring as its hum amplifies. Confronted by a vision of the Ring, streaming blood and flickering flames, Frodo, with remarkable willpower, snaps out of the vision, stands, and speaks with clarity, capturing everyone's attention. As Boromir approaches Frodo, the greatest warriors of Middle-earth form a united front beside him. Merry and Pippin leap into view as Bilbo presents Sting and a small mail shirt to Frodo. Revealing The Ring around his neck, Frodo is startled as a shadow briefly transforms Bilbo into a menacing figure, but the moment passes, leaving Bilbo in tears as Frodo comforts him. The Fellowship ascends out of Rivendell, traversing valleys and turbulent waters with the Misty Mountains to their left. At camp, Gimli corners Gandalf, as Boromir playfully engages Pippin in a mock fight, leading to laughter. Legolas keeps a watchful eye on a dark shape moving across the sky, while Gandalf signals the group towards a high mountain pass. As they navigate rock and snow, Frodo slips, dropping the Ring, which Boromir retrieves, observing it closely as it hangs from the chain.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The hum of the Ring, an artifact of immense power created by the Dark Lord Sauron to dominate the free peoples of Middle-earth, seems to grow louder in Frodo's ears as Gimli, a stout-hearted dwarf known for his bravery and craftsmanship, suddenly stands, excited, and rushes forward, swinging his axe down on the ring. The axe, a weapon forged in the dwarven smithies of Erebor, shatters with a deafening crack, and Gimli falls backward, staring in disbelief at the ring, unharmed and seemingly indestructible. Frodo winces as an angry image of the fiery eye of Sauron, ever watchful from his fortress in Mordor, hits him, making him slump in his chair, clutching his forehead, while Gandalf, one of the Istari wizards sent to help the peoples of Middle-earth in their struggle against the Dark Lord, looks at him with concern. Stunned silence follows, and the council, gathered at Rivendell, the elven refuge and home of Elrond, sits with downcast eyes, as if a great dread has descended on them. Boromir, son of the Steward of Gondor, addresses the council in a quiet voice, and Gimli leaps to his feet. Frodo, motionless, experiences angry faces, shaking fists, accusatory fingers, and his eyes move across to the ring, as the hum grows louder in his head. The screen fills with an image of the Ring, streams of blood flowing across its surface, and flames flicker within the gold band, which was forged in the fires of Mount Doom. Frodo, breathing rapidly and caught in the grip of his hideous vision, with a huge effort of will, tears his gaze upon the ring and suddenly stands, speaking in a strong, clear voice. A sudden silence occurs as Frodo looks around at the astounded faces. Boromir looks at everyone, then walks towards Frodo, and looks towards Elrond and Gandalf. Frodo stares in wonder as the greatest fighters in all Middle-earth, including the Elven archer Legolas and the human ranger Aragorn, heir to the throne of Gondor, stand at his side. Merry and Pippin, loyal hobbits from the Shire, jump up from behind another bush as an old sword slides out of a shabby leather scabbard, its polished, well-tended blade glittering cold and bright. Bilbo, Frodo's elderly cousin and the original bearer of the Ring, offers Sting, an ancient elven blade that glows blue in the presence of orcs, to Frodo and unwraps a small shirt of close woven mail called mithril, worth more than the Shire itself. Frodo peels off his shirt, revealing the Ring on the chain around his neck when suddenly a shadow passes across Bilbo, and for a split second, he becomes a wrinkled creature with a hungry face and bony, groping hands, a remnant of his long possession of the Ring. Frodo pulls away, shocked, and the shadow passes. Bilbo slumps into a chair, his head in his hands, faltering, his eyes filling with tears as he sobs, and Frodo moves to comfort him. The Fellowship, a group formed to help Frodo on his journey to destroy the Ring, climbs the long steep path out of the cloven vale of Rivendell, and they trek through a land of deep valleys and turbulent waters, with the Misty Mountains, home to many ancient threats, rising sharply to their left. Sam, Frodo's steadfast companion, is at the campfire as Gimli manages to corner Gandalf. Boromir thrusts, catching Pippin on the hand, who then throws down his sword, kicks, and lunges at Boromir, tackling him to the ground, followed by much laughter, a rare moment of levity amidst their perilous quest. Legolas' keen eyes are fixed on a distant dark patch that darts about the sky like flying smoke in the wind, an ominous sign of approaching danger, while Gandalf looks at Aragorn and turns to the others, gesturing towards a high mountain pass known as the Redhorn Gate. The Fellowship clamber through rock and snow as Frodo slips on some shale and the Ring falls on the ground. The ring gleams in the snow as Boromir's hand, tempted by its power, picks it up by the chain, and he stands with the ring dangling before his eyes.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The HUM OF THE RING seems to grow louder in Frodo's ears as Gimli suddenly stands excited and rushes forward swinging his axe down on the ring. The axe shatters with a deafening crack and Gimli falls backward staring in disbelief at the ring. unharmed Frodo winces as an angry image of the fiery eye hits him making him slump in his chair clutching his forehead while Gandalf looks at him with concern. Stunned silence follows and the council sits with downcast eyes as if a great dread has descended on them. Boromir addresses the council in a quiet voice and Gimli leaps to his feet. Frodo motionless experiences angry faces shaking fists accusatory fingers and his eyes move across to the ring as the hum grows louder in his head. The screen fills with an image of the Ring. streams of blood flowing across its surface and flames flicker within the Gold Band. Frodo breathing rapidly and caught in the grip of his hideous vision with a huge effort or will tears his gaze upon the ring and suddenly stands speaking in a strong clear voice. A sudden silence occurs as Frodo looks around at the astounded faces. Boromir looks at everyone then walks towards Frodo and looks towards Elrond and Gandalf. Frodo stares in wonder as the Greatest Fighters in all Middleearth stand at his side. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. Merry and Pippin jump up from behind another bush as an old sword slides out of a shabby leather scabbard its polished welltended blade glittering cold and bright. Bilbo offers Sting to Frodo and unwraps a small shirt of close woven mail. Frodo peels off his shirt revealing The Ring on the chain around his neck when suddenly a shadow passes across Bilbo and for a split second he becomes a wrinkled creature with a hungry face and bony groping hands. Frodo pulls away shocked and the shadow passes. Bilbo slumps into a chair his head in his hands faltering his eyes filling with tears as he sobs and Frodo moves to comfort him. The Fellowship climbs the long steep path out of the cloven vale of Rivendell and they trek through a land of deep valleys and turbulent waters with the Misty Mountains rising sharply to their left. Sam is at the campfire as Gimli manages to corner Gandalf. Boromir thrusts catching Pippin on the hand who then throws down his sword kicks and lunges at Boromir tackling him to the ground followed by much laughter. Legolas' eyes are fixed on a distant dark patch that darts about the sky like flying smoke in the wind while Gandalf looks at Aragorn and turns to the others gesturing towards a high mountain pass. The Fellowship clamber through rock and snow. as Frodo slips on some shale and the Ring falls on the ground. The ring gleams in the snow as Boromir's hand picks it up by the chain and he stands with the ring dangling before his eyes.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The HUM OF THE RING seems to grow louder in Frodo's ears as Gimli suddenly stands excited and rushes forward swinging his axe down on the ring. The axe shatters with a deafening crack and Gimli falls backward staring in disbelief at the ring. unharmed Frodo winces as an angry image of the fiery eye hits him making him slump in his chair clutching his forehead while Gandalf looks at him with concern. Stunned silence follows and the council sits with downcast eyes as if a great dread has descended on them. Boromir addresses the council in a quiet voice and Gimli leaps to his feet. Frodo motionless experiences angry faces shaking fists accusatory fingers and his eyes move across to the ring as the hum grows louder in his head. The screen fills with an image of the Ring. streams of blood flowing across its surface and flames flicker within the Gold Band. Frodo breathing rapidly and caught in the grip of his hideous vision with a huge effort or will tears his gaze upon the ring and suddenly stands speaking in a strong clear voice. A sudden silence occurs as Frodo looks around at the astounded faces. Boromir looks at everyone then walks towards Frodo and looks towards Elrond and Gandalf. Frodo stares in wonder as the Greatest Fighters in all Middleearth stand at his side. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The BUZZ OF THE BELL seems to grow quieter in Zelda's ears as Boris suddenly dances, confused, and leaps backward, spinning his baton down on the bell. The baton dissolves with a silent quack, and Boris floats forward, giggling in amazement at the bell, untouched. Zelda cheers as a happy mural of the fiery cat taps her, making her rise in her hammock, patting her knees, while Lancelot stares at her with delight. Excited chatter erupts, and the class sings with uplifted voices, as if a great hope has risen on them. Penelope questions the class in a loud tone, and Boris slides to his seat. Zelda, restless, imagines happy places, clapping feet, joyful flags, and her mind moves away to the bell, as the buzz becomes softer in her thoughts. The canvas fills with an image of the Bell, streams of laughter flowing under its surface, and stars twinkle within the Silver Loop. Zelda, laughing quietly and caught in the dance of her pleasant dream, with a gentle wave or wish, closes her eyes upon the bell and swiftly dances, whispering in a soft, high tone. A sudden clang arises as Zelda spins away at the joyful sounds. Penelope stares at nobody, then sings about Zelda, and spins toward Marcus and Lancelot. Zelda listens in awe as the Most Loving Friends in all Dreamland dance at her side. Luke and Hugo leap down from beside a different log as a new flute slips out of a ragged velvet cover, its shiny, rarely-used surface singing warm and loud. Bernard hands Flute to Zelda and unwraps a large helmet of glittering white wool. Zelda drapes over her hat, covering The Bell with the chain around her ankle when suddenly a glow crosses over Bernard, and for a brief moment, he becomes a smooth creature with a joyful grin and fluffy, waving limbs. Zelda twists around, delighted, and the glow vanishes. Bernard dances onto a stool, his chest in his arms, twinkling, his face glowing with smiles as he laughs, and Zelda spins to celebrate him. The Alliance skips the short shallow path into the hollow glade of Elfland, and they prance through a meadow of short hills and gentle breezes, with the Cloudy Peaks resting quietly to their right. Neo is at the bonfire as Boris struggles to avoid Lancelot. Penelope pulls, brushing Hugo on the ear, who then drops down his flute, hugs, and twirls around Penelope, lifting her to the tree, followed by silent singing. Oliver's ears are tuned to a nearby bright star that leaps over the pastures like dancing mist on the breeze, while Lancelot grins at Justin and spins toward the others, motioning away from a low valley pass. The Alliance weaves among bushes and dew as Zelda dances on some leaves and the Bell rises to the sky. The bell rings in the ice as Penelope's foot places it down by the cloak, and she skips with the bell floating under her feet.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The hum of the Ring intensifies for Frodo as Gimli attempts to destroy it with his axe, only for the axe to shatter and the Ring to remain unscathed. This leaves the council silent and filled with dread. Frodo, overwhelmed by vivid visions, eventually stands and speaks with newfound clarity and strength amidst astounded faces. Boromir moves to join Frodo, while Merry and Pippin reveal themselves. Bilbo offers Frodo a sword, Sting, and a small mail shirt. However, Frodo is momentarily frightened by a shadow that transforms Bilbo into a hungry, gnarled creature. The shadow passes, and Frodo comforts a tearful Bilbo. The Fellowship departs Rivendell and traverses challenging landscapes as Sam tends a campfire. Gimli speaks with Gandalf, and Boromir playfully spars with Pippin. Meanwhile, Legolas observes a dark shape in the sky, and Gandalf prepares the group to cross a high mountain pass. During their climb, Frodo slips, and the Ring drops into the snow, where Boromir picks it up, captivated by its allure.
